page.title: 18Hayes Hill and HolyfieldHall
page.content: We visited these farms on 24th June 1985.They are on the east of the Lea Valley Park.Hayes Hill farm is like a model farm.It contains many different breeds of pigs,goats,sheep,cows,horses, poultry,rabbits and a fox.We were able to touch lots of these animals as they were quite tame. Holyfieldhall Farm is a working mixed farm.It grows wheat for baking,barley for brewing,duram wheat for pasta and ley grass for silage.The silage is fed to the 150 Friesian dairy cows in the winter.In the summer they graze on rough pasture.Their milk is sold to United Dairies.If the farmer produces more milk than his quota he is fined 17p a litre.The farm machinery included a combine harvester,manure spreader and tractors.
